name: Monstera Siltepecana
climate: Monstera Siltepecana thrives in tropical climates with high humidity.
It prefers temperatures that remain consistently warm throughout the year.
Avoid exposing it to cold drafts or temperatures below 50Â°F.
A greenhouse environment can be ideal for maintaining proper climate.
sunlight: Monstera Siltepecana prefers bright, indirect sunlight to thrive.
Direct sunlight can cause leaf burn, so avoid harsh afternoon sun.
It can tolerate lower light conditions but will grow more slowly.
A location near a window with filtered light is ideal.
watering: Water the plant when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure proper drainage.
Reduce watering frequency during the plant's dormant winter period.
Misting can help to increase humidity and benefit the plant.
soil: A well-draining potting mix rich in organic matter is best.
A mixture of peat, perlite, and orchid bark can be effective.
Ensure the soil retains moisture but does not become waterlogged.
Repot every couple of years to replenish soil nutrients.
toxic: Monstera Siltepecana is toxic to cats and dogs if ingested.
Symptoms of toxicity include oral irritation and digestive upset.
extra_care_tip: Provide a moss pole or support for climbing as it matures.
Regularly rotate the plant to ensure even growth on all sides.
